white: The flashlight core in the corrupted core bin.
That time a family got really angry at the adoption jokes in Portal 2.
The noise the hard light bridge makes when you jump on it.
The fact that 50-foot omnipotent power-mad AIs are scared of birds.
The invention of pants by sailors in the 16th century to avoid Poseidon's wrath.
Chell finally speaking and having a horrible Australian accent.
Wheatley's euphoric reaction to testing while in the chassis.
GLaDOS, absolutely covered in screaming birds.
The autotune effect used to make GLaDOS's voice.
The part where he kills you.
The Aperture Science Weighted Storage Cube.
Fanart of peoples' weird fursonas jumping between portals.
People misspelling Wheatley's name as Wheatly.
A plot twist that reveals Chell is actually the Gman reincarnated.
The first person to discover that cow's milk is drinkable.
Chell finally speaking and having a thick southern accent.
The Lego Dimensions Portal level pack.
The discourse about tall, blonde, skinny Wheatley humanizations.
Cave Johnson's attempts at tax evasion.
GLaDOS's descent into a crazy bird lady.
Wheatley's bad American accent changing depending on region.
The theory that Caroline is Chell's mother.
A cool Portal AU where the robots retain the quality of not being human.
The rumored JJ Abrams Portal movie.
That HISHE video where Chell and Gordon Freeman communicate in blatantly fake sign language.
Justin Roiland making 5 minutes of soup impressions.
A loss.jpg created by rearranging panels from Lab Rat.
Rick pulling somebody's underwear up their butt.
The Aperture Science Vital Apparatus Vent.
The theory that Chell is a vortigaunt.
The 87.61% probability of Chell dying violently in the next five minutes.
The Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device.
Wheatley vibrating intensely in place while listening to pop music.
The weird noises you can hear in the track "Ghost of Rattmann".
The noise P-Body sometimes makes that sound like "tootsie roll".
Any or all of Fact Core's slightly but not completely incorrect statements.
The one in six children statistically proven to be abducted by the Dutch.
Blatant misinformation spewed by the Fact Core.
People loudly voicing the theory that Caroline is Chell's mother on ChellDOS ship art.
Chapter 9: The Part Where He Kills You.
The voice acting in Portal: Prelude.
Wheatley being put in the Pear Wiggler to atone for his sins.
Every single sentry turret in the facility.
Portal: No Escape, a live-action fan film by Dan Tratchenburg.
This roleplay from 2012 I was in called Portal Wars.
The Aperture Science Weighted Companion Cube.
The 234 words in the Eskimo language for fudge.
A Steven Universe AU where ATLAS and P-Body are a permafusion like Garnet.
Weird interspecies human on robot shipping.
The theory that companion cubes contain dead bodies.
Wheatley being given any reign over critical or delicate equipment whatsoever.
The fact that Chell could plausibly be a master builder in the Lego Movie universe.
Space Core's dreams of going to space.
Blaring sirens in the background of most of Wheatley's theme music.
Chell decking Gordon Freeman in the face.
Space Core's dad, who is space.
Fanart where Chell's missing her undershirt for some reason.
Lesbian subtext between Chell and GLaDOS.
That video of GLaDOS screaming in assorted languages.
The Aperture Science Heavy-Duty Super-Colliding Super Button.
Hidden SSTV messages in the updated ending of the first Portal.
The gigantic prototype portal gun from the 50s.
My inability to find a co-op partner.
The couple thousand humans in cryogenic storage.
All of the switches in the main breaker room.
Sans and Papyrus's uncanny resemblance to ATLAS and P-Body.
The HTC Vive Virtual Reality Tutorial.
The astounding lack of coresonas in the Portal fandom.
An AU where Doug paints entirely in anime style.
Hepatitis given by cellular phones that do not cause cancer.
Buying $70,000,000 worth of moon rocks even though the bean counters told you not to.
Raseph, a Semitic god with an gazelle growing out of his forehead.
Somebody's idea to get GLaDOS a stress toy.
An AU where the robots are humanized, but they're all Gollum.
The robot dog from The Lab.
Cave Johnson setting himself on fire.
GLaDOS decking Breengrub in the face to establish dominance.
The need to ingest 200 pounds of helium prior to the Wright Brother's invention of flight.
ATLAS and P-Body after learning several lewd hand gestures.
Wheatley's shitty Sonic the Hedgehog OC.
Joint Portal/Gravity Falls/Rick and Morty crossovers.
That CTRL+ALT+DEL comic where the Steam controllers are portals to Gaben's nipples.
